description: Intermediate high school biology course focusing on biochemical molecules, cellular processes, genetics foundations, molecular biology, evolution, and human physiology. Designed to build deeper conceptual understanding and prepare students for advanced senior-level biology.

topics.name: Unit 1: Biochemical Molecules I – Carbohydrates & Lipids
topics.description: Biological elements, molecular structure of carbohydrates, monosaccharides, disaccharides, polysaccharides, lipid types (fats, oils, phospholipids, steroids), energy storage, membrane structure, dehydration synthesis, hydrolysis reactions, and functional significance of macromolecules

topics.name: Unit 2: Biochemical Molecules II – Proteins & Nucleic Acids
topics.description: Amino acids, peptide bonds, protein structure levels (primary, secondary, tertiary, quaternary), enzyme roles, DNA vs RNA structure, nucleotides, base pairing rules, ATP, and the importance of macromolecules in cellular activities

topics.name: Unit 3: Cell Processes – Enzymes & Respiration
topics.description: Enzyme structure, active site, activation energy, enzyme specificity, factors affecting enzyme activity (temperature, pH, concentration), cellular respiration overview, glycolysis, Krebs cycle, electron transport chain, ATP production, aerobic vs anaerobic respiration, and fermentation

topics.name: Unit 4: Cell Processes – Photosynthesis
topics.description: Chloroplast structure, pigments, light-dependent reactions, Calvin cycle, factors influencing photosynthesis, comparison of photosynthesis and respiration, energy conversion, and importance of photosynthesis in ecosystems

topics.name: Unit 5: Cell Division & Genetics Foundations
topics.description: Mitosis review, meiosis stages, chromosome behavior, gamete formation, genetic variation, Mendelian genetics introduction, alleles, simple inheritance patterns, Punnett squares, genotypes and phenotypes, and probability rules

topics.name: Unit 6: Molecular Genetics & Protein Synthesis
topics.description: DNA replication, transcription, translation, mRNA, tRNA, rRNA, codons, genetic code, mutations, gene expression, regulation basics, and the relationship between DNA, genes, proteins, and traits

topics.name: Unit 7: Evolution & Natural Selection
topics.description: Evidence for evolution, Darwin’s theory, mechanisms of natural selection, adaptation, variation, speciation introduction, artificial vs natural selection, and evolutionary patterns

topics.name: Unit 8: Human Physiology I – Control Systems
topics.description: Nervous system structure and function, neurons, reflex arcs, endocrine system hormones, homeostasis mechanisms, feedback loops, and coordination between nervous and endocrine systems

topics.name: Unit 9: Human Physiology II & Ecology
topics.description: Digestive, circulatory, respiratory, and excretory system overviews, immune system basics, population ecology, energy flow in ecosystems, nutrient cycles, environmental challenges, and human impact on ecosystems
